posts._title: Suneil Sanzgiri – Letter from Your Far-Off Country (2020)
posts.title: Letter from Your Far-Off Country
posts.excerpt: Shot with 16mm film stock that expired in 2002—the same year as the state-sponsored anti-Muslim genocide in Gujarat—and filmed amid the anti-CAA protests in Delhi, the filmmaker traces lines and lineages of ancestral memory, poetry, history, songs, and ruins from his birth in 1989.

posts._title: Fred Zinnemann – Behold a Pale Horse (1964)
posts.title: Behold a Pale Horse
posts.excerpt: Manuel Artiguez, a famous bandit during the Spanish civil war, has lived in French exile for 20 years. When his mother is dying he considers visiting her secretly in his Spanish home town. But his biggest enemy, the Spanish police officer Vinolas, prepared a trap at the hospital as a chance to finally catch Artiguez.

posts.title: Hana chirinu
posts.excerpt: Quote:Set against the backdrop of an imperial victory in the civil war leading up to the Meiji Restoration, Fallen Blossoms tells the story of the sorrows of women in a geisha house in Kyoto by recounting the relationships of its inhabitants.

posts._title: Reza Riahi – Navazandeh AKA The Musician (2020)
posts.title: Navazandeh
